image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Pham Minh Chinh standing in front of a building with military and young Vietnamese children holding flags.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says two Australian citizens who faced the death penalty in Vietnam have now been granted clemency.

title.children: Two Australians granted clemency in Vietnam

image.altText: BRS

items.synopsis: War veteran Ben Roberts-Smith may have committed a criminal offence by sending threatening letters to a former SAS colleague, a Federal Court judge finds.

title.children: Disgraced war veteran may have committed criminal offence, judge finds

image.altText: a man wearing an army uniform looking sideways

items.synopsis: Justice Anthony Besanko releases his full judgement after dismissing Ben Roberts-Smith's defamation suit on Thursday. This is how it unfolded

title.children: As it happened: Ben Roberts-Smith full findings revealed, judge says he 'was not an honest witness'

image.altText: A woman, Kathleen Folbigg, sits in front of a microphone at a desk in a courtroom

items.synopsis: Twenty years after she was jailed for killing her four children, Kathleen Folbigg has been pardoned and released from prison. She has a few options available.

title.children: What options are available to Kathleen Folbigg, after being imprisoned for 20 years?

image.altText: A composite image with sepia tones of a woman's face, and four baby photographs.

items.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg was no stranger to tragedy when all of her children died before their second birthdays. This is how someone once known as Australia's worst female serial killer was freed from prison.

title.children: Long road to freedom: Kathleen Folbigg's tragic life started well before her babies died

image.altText: Victorian governor Margaret Gardner

items.synopsis: Victoria's 30th governor, Monash University vice-chancellor Margaret Gardner AC, says while she is a republican she does not believe her views will pose any obstacle to her when she takes up her role in August.

title.children: Margaret Gardner, announced as pick for Victoria's next governor, says she is a republican

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large refugee camp.

items.synopsis: A group of 26 Australians living in a camp in Syria have launched legal action against the Department of Home Affairs. Lawyers for the women and children say they were tricked into going to the conflict zone.

title.children: Australian citizens in IS-linked Syrian camp file legal action against the federal government

image.altText: A man looks to his left as he buttons his suit jacket

items.synopsis: Prince Harry's no-show at court on the first day of his individual case against a tabloid newspaper was "absolutely extraordinary", the newspaper's lawyers say.

title.children: 'Time wasting': Prince Harry misses court after celebrating Lilibet's birthday

image.altText: Drone footage shows an explosion in a green field.

items.synopsis: Russia claims to have thwarted a major Ukrainian offensive in the Donetsk region, killing hundreds of troops, while Kyiv accuses Moscow of spreading lies.

title.children: Russia claims it thwarted major Ukrainian offensive, Kyiv says Moscow spreads lies

image.altText: Lauren Fried and Jock Zonfrillo pose together and smile for a selfie posted to Instagram

items.synopsis: The widow of chef Jock Zonfrillo speaks for the first time in a video posted to social media, telling followers of her late husband's Instagram account that she wished he knew how loved he was by people "all over the world".

title.children: 'Overwhelmed by the messages': Jock Zonfrillo's widow speaks publicly for the first time since chef's death

image.altText: An illustration of Islamic State iconography superimposed over a browser window containing an image of Rick Astley.

items.synopsis: Defeating Islamic State militants required disabling their significant cyber capabilities — and pop star Rick Astley unwittingly played a hand in doing so.

title.children: In the heat of battle, IS militants' phones were hijacked thanks to Australians inspired by Rick Astley

image.altText: A man stands in front of a lectern.

items.synopsis: A court hears that Richard Hayden used money that should have gone to clients for their home deposits to pay for luxury holidays and medical bills for his dying wife. It brought an end to an almost 100-year-old family company.

title.children: Real estate agent admits stealing from clients to give dying wife a good end to life

image.altText: A man of colour in a blue suit and white shirt stands and points at a computer screen where a young Asian woman is working.

items.synopsis: With productivity falling in Australia and AI developments advancing, could the technology be the answer to boosting output, or will it cause more job losses?

title.children: Amit's firm has modelled the jobs most likely to be affected by AI. The top 10 might surprise you

image.altText: A woman holds up a sign while standing next to a police officer.

items.synopsis: Hong Kong police detain 23 people for "breaching public peace" as authorities ramp up security for the 34th anniversary of the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown.

title.children: Police detain 23 people in Hong Kong on Tiananmen anniversary

image.altText: A woman outside a court building in handcuffs.

items.synopsis: Crystal Leanne Hanley is granted home detention bail to clean up her SA Housing rental property, which the prosecutor has described as being "unsuitable for human habitation".

title.children: Woman charged with daughter's manslaughter granted home detention bail to clean up 'squalid' rental

image.altText: US Air Force F-16 fighter jets in the sky.

items.synopsis: US fighter jets cause a sonic boom across the US capital while scrambling to reach an unresponsive aircraft that ultimately crashed in the mountains of Virginia.

title.children: No survivors found after plane that flew over US capital and led to fighter jet scramble crashes in Virginia

image.altText: A man surrounded by cameras.

items.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's interview on 7NEWS Spotlight was largely a retelling of the defence arguments in his trial but, for many Australians, it was the first time hearing his version of events, in his own words.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's TV interview was many Australians' first time hearing him speak

image.altText: The main entrance of the Coffs Harbour Courthouse.

items.synopsis: The City of Coffs Harbour has been fined $20,000 after a judge found it was aware of its obligations to maintain its gas collection system, but failed to do so.

title.children: NSW council fined after tip management leaves stench over coastal town

image.altText: a generic photo of young girls in an afghan school

items.synopsis: An education official says two separate primary schools were targeted with an unknown poison.

title.children: Two separate poison attacks carried out against young Afghan schoolgirls

image.altText: Peter Moiler is smiling while wearing a green jacket in an outdoor setting

items.synopsis: A mother of three who suffered burns to 40 per cent of her body in an alleged domestic violence incident is described as a "kind and caring" person.

title.children: Woman who suffered 'life-changing' burns after ex-partner allegedly set her on fire described as 'wonderful mother'

image.altText: Gary leans over Monic who is sitting in a hospital chair holding their baby

items.synopsis: Amid a cost-of-living crisis, international students in Australia will soon be forced to cut their working hours as previous rules put on hold to address labour shortages are reintroduced.

title.children: International students given grace period on working hours argue for the change to stay

image.altText: CCTV still shot of a man in a green long-sleeve shirt running in an undercover space

items.synopsis: A man who had been jailed for assault is found two days after he allegedly ditched his handcuffs and fled from a Rockhampton hospital.

title.children: Tip-off helps police track down prisoner after hospital escape

image.altText: A close shot of Bandt's face, looking serious and wearing glasses.

items.synopsis: The Greens adopt a new party position on Palestine and Israel, saying Israel is practising the "crime of apartheid".

title.children: Greens call for boycott of far-right Israeli leaders

image.altText: A number of gold bars lined up and being stamped by a worker using a hammer.

items.synopsis: Australia's third biggest gold miner, Evolution Mining, has approved a $250 million expansion of its Mungari operations near Kalgoorlie, despite concerns about the overheated construction sector.

title.children: WA gold mine set to double capacity after $250m expansion gets green light

image.altText: A man looks on during a State of Origin match

items.synopsis: Nicho Hynes is the lead to replace Nathan Cleary in State of Origin II with the Cronulla playmaker receiving a ringing endorsement from a key Blue.

title.children: With Nathan Cleary sidelined, can Nicho Hynes step up for New South Wales in Origin II?

image.altText: Lady of justice statue outside Brisbane's Supreme and District Courts building.

items.synopsis: Stephanie Carroll worked as the sole director of a Ballarat fitness business despite receiving weekly stress payments, a court has heard.

title.children: Fitness studio boss ordered to repay fraudulent workers comp benefits

image.altText: A composite image of close up photos of two men's faces

items.synopsis: Police alleged Jamie Lauder, 20, and Justin Roberts, 23, escaped from the low-security compound of the Darwin Correctional Facility in Holtze on Saturday night.

title.children: Police search underway for inmates after alleged escape from Darwin prison

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg broke down whilst giving evidence in court in 2019

items.synopsis: Craig Folbigg's lawyer said his client's view "has not changed whatsoever" as his ex-wife walks free after two decades behind bars.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg pardoned after 20 years in jail, as ex-husband maintains her guilt

image.altText: A man takes photos of a car driving towards him

items.synopsis: The inquest found Nigel Harris, 60, died from multiple blunt force injuries after being hit by a competing trophy truck in 2021.

title.children: Coroner finds Finke safety measures 'entirely inadequate' prior to spectator death

image.altText: Above-ground powerlines string above the treetops against the backdrop of a golden sunset

items.synopsis: Class action proceedings are launched against AGL Energy accusing it of breaching the competition and consumer act in relation to bidding in the South Australian region of the National Energy Market.

title.children: Class action launched against AGL over alleged competition and consumer law breaches

image.altText: a large group shot of protesters walking and holding up phones and flags down a street

items.synopsis: Almost half a million protesters marched through Warsaw in fear their country is moving away from democracy.

title.children: Thousands march in Polish anti-government protests in Warsaw

image.altText: Man at airport watching plane take off

items.synopsis: The federal government should consider forcing airlines to pay passengers compensation if their flights get cancelled or delayed, a new consumer watchdog report says.

title.children: Should airlines be forced to compensate passengers for cancelled flights? The ACCC says it's worth considering
